intro: Phyteuma ellipticum, commonly known as the narrowleaf phyteuma, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its elongated, narrow leaves and clusters of bell-shaped, often pink or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in meadows, woodlands, and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soils. It blooms in late summer to early autumn, adding vibrant color to its natural habitat. Phyteuma ellipticum is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ease of care.
